body: Hi @praksharma, can you run `env | grep MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI` to see whether `MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI` is set or not?

Hi, it is empty.

```sh
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu]$ env | grep MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu]$ 
```

So, i exported my `PWD` to `MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI`. But still it shows me the same 5 days old training from a different directory.

```sh
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu]$ export MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI=$PWD
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu]$ env | grep MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI
MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI=/scratch/s.1915438/2. inverse+forward/15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu]$ mlflow ui
[2022-11-22 10:59:46 +0000] [54106] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.1.0
[2022-11-22 10:59:46 +0000] [54106] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:5000 (54106)
[2022-11-22 10:59:46 +0000] [54106] [INFO] Using worker: sync
[2022-11-22 10:59:46 +0000] [54107] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 54107
```
Is there some sort of cache which it loads by default? I check the hidden files. Nothing there.

The one starting with `10.` is the 5 days older results. The one starting with `15.` is my directory of interest.
```
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 2. inverse+forward]$ ls
10. mlflow and hydra         13. Optuna multiple best value using Hydra Zen   15. hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu  4. one inverse model               7. working
11. hydra + mlflow + optuna  14. Joblib_parallel_standard                     2. logging                      5. Hydra conf + inverse            8. conf with dictionary
12. Horovod                  1. 5 data points                                 3. Hyda hyperparamter tuning    6. inverse + logger (not working)  9. multi gpu submitit
```

One more thing, I just found in this directory `10. mlflow and hydra `, mlflow is creating a new directory each time I create a new experiment in `mlflow ui` alongside the existing one created 5 days ago.

```sh
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 2. inverse+forward]$ cd 10.\ mlflow\ and\ hydra/
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) 10. mlflow and hydra]$ cd mlruns/
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) mlruns]$ ls
0  5
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) mlruns]$ ls 5
meta.yaml
[s.1915438@scs2043(sunbird) mlruns]$ cat 5/meta.yaml 
artifact_location: file:///scratch/s.1915438/2.%20inverse%2Bforward/15.%20hydra_zen_joblib_multi_gpu/mlruns/0/09d31d5799924d6fae0285debe29819f/artifacts
creation_time: 1669116148391
experiment_id: '5'
last_update_time: 1669116148391
lifecycle_stage: active
name: new_1
```

This is weird.
@praksharma Can you create an empty directory, move in the directory, run `mlflow server`, and open `http://127.0.0.1:5000`?

I finally deleted this folder `10. mlflow and hydra `. Now I can't use `mlflow ui`.  It says "Something went wrong". 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70601302/203307102-03e91cfa-79ae-4a93-b544-a6e81f71067a.png)

I tried creating an empty directory and ran `mlflow server` I get the same message. I reinstalled `mlflow` using `pip install mlflow[extras] --upgrade`. I get the same error. Did I just nuke the `mlflow`?
Have you run a tracking server against `10. mlflow and hydra ` before?
Sorry, I don't remember. How do I revert it and make things normal?

> I finally deleted this folder 10. mlflow and hydra . Now I can't use mlflow ui. It says "Something went wrong".

This indicates there is a tracking server running against `10. mlflow and hydra`. `pkill -f mlflow` should kill it.

Thank you so much. I can finally see the training in action.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70601302/203311707-03868493-c5e6-487c-af5b-0d03955cd974.png)
Looks like a server was running in the backend. This one worked `pkill -f mlflow`.

> Looks like a server was running in the backend.

On which port was this server running?

So, I was using an HPC cluster not local PC. There are multiple login nodes with its own set of ports. It was running on `sl1` port 5000. I was using `sl2` port 5000. The problem is when I was port forwarding the port 5000 to my local PC I was not specifying the login node, so connects me to the `sl1` port 5000. I will just make sure that I port forward from within the same login node. Also, I will use a different port using `mlflow ui --port <PORT>`. This command is useful preventive measure `pkill -f mlflow`.
Makes sense. Thanks for the reply :)
